page.title: 06TYPES OF FARMING
page.content: The land around{Moss and Fenwick}was wetland. The soil is mainly clay. It has been drained and now is fertile and used for{crops}such as wheat, oats, cereal, beans, linseed oil rape, potatoes, barley, peas and roots.There is also pasture land around the farms and villages. There are also{farm {animals}like beef cattle, dairy cows, horses, pigs and hens with dogs to help and cats for rodent control. There are{18 farms}in our area. Most of the 18 farms have not been modernised for the past 20 years. A lot of the families have been farming there for over 50 years, and one family for over 200 years. 3 farms are entirely arable, 1 farm breeds horses, and the other farms have mixed farming.
